definition: magical hands bring the dying back to life (idiom); miracle cure/brilliant doctor
clever/wonderful
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
spring (season)/gay/joyful/youthful/love/lust/life
surname Chun

sentences.english: The two physicians alone could offer any hops when danger was extreme.
sentences.chinese: 只有這兩位醫師能夠妙手回春。

sentences.english: The doctor is highly competent, many patients recover their lost hearing after receiving treatment.
sentences.chinese: 這位醫生妙手回春，不少耳聾的人經治療復聰了。

sentences.english: Doctors cannot effect a cure if the disease has spread too far.
sentences.chinese: 假如這種疾病已擴散得厲害，醫生也無法妙手回春。

sentences.english: The older uncle buttoned, small beans finally able to speak.
sentences.chinese: 經老五叔妙手回春，小豆子終於能說話了。

sentences.english: The natural healing arts have been with us for ages, and can often be very powerful - by engaging and supporting our body's Innate Wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 自然療法已經伴隨人類多年，並且經常能夠妙手回春。

sentences.english: It was said that she was as effective as god, bringing the dying back to life.
sentences.chinese: 她是個妙手回春的民間醫生。

definition: benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed
to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
practice medicine or pharmacy to help the people or public
miraculous hands of a healer/highly skilled person/brilliant move in chess or weiqi (go) 圍棋|围棋
medical expertise/art of healing
lit. set out and it becomes spring (idiom); to effect a miracle cure (of medical operation)/to bring back the dead/once it starts, everything goes well
lit. the disease is cured the moment the medicine is taken (idiom)/fig. (of a medical treatment) to give instant results/(of a solution or method) highly effective
kindness/benevolence/to govern in humanitarian way
good doctor/skilled doctor
famous doctor
to cure
to treat the disease to save the patient/to criticize a person in order to help him
divine physician/sage doctor/highly skilled practitioner
medical ethics
return of spring
(literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
